resources.string:
\ Soap. Clean hands and a clean conscience.

 How clean are your hands? If you can't answer that, then you need Soap.

 With Soap, you'll have aggregated data on your daily hand washing habits. You can export this data by email, and easily analyze it. This means it's great for hospitals and other institutions.


 Soap Features:
- A monitoring service that runs during user-defined periods
 - An easy way to signal a hand washing event - simply tap your phone with the screen off
- Automatic saving of daily hand washing data to a CSV spreadsheet and quick exportation by email

To get started with Soap, just download it and set up the automatic monitoring times. Then when you want to signal that you've washed your hands, just tap your phone's screen twice when the screen is off. The phone will vibrate indicating that it's detected the signal. Tap once more for confirmation, and you're all set!

\ Sudoku is a logic-based number placement puzzle. Starting with a partially completed 9x9 grid, the objective is to fill the grid so that each row, each column, and each of the 3x3 boxes (also called blocks) contains the digits 1 to 9 exactly once.

\ I would like to acknowledge the creators of the sample code within the Android SDK. For example the writers of FingerPainting. I would also like to acknowledge the Android developer\'s website for their sample code in SQLite, local storage, and 2D graphics. I would like to thank freesounds.org for their audio. Finally, I would like to thank the creators and writers of Hello, Android for their Sudoku code, which we have sampled.

\ The rules are fairly simple. Sign in as you already have. Then you can choose to play single player or multi player. Both will work to help your high score. When choosing an opponent, simply click on the person you would like to play against. A message will be sent to them and when they accept, your game will begin. There is 1 point for the first three letters in any word and another point for each letter following. Can not use the same word twice.

\ Instructions:

 	Visit the User Settings page to set automatic sensing of hand washing when the screen is off. Or simply hit the Start Monitor button. If you want to turn this monitor off, hit Stop Monitor. When sensing is turned on and the screen is off, tap until you feel it vibrate (three times), then tap again for a double vibrate. The double vibration means the phone has sensed you washed your hands. Use the Export Data button to send the day's data to a specified email address. It will send a CSV Excel spreadsheet.

 Acknowledgements:

	We would like to acknowledge user MyLock on StackOverflow for providing us answers and code in order to keep our service running when the screen locks and shuts off. Other examples on StackOverflow were also helpful. Thank you to apple for high pass filter code (adapted from Obj-C) so that we could eliminate gravity from the accelerometer readings. Thank you to the Christian Service Center for their soap image. Thank you to the CSVopensource project and their API for easily creating excel combatible files. Thanks to http://ttfonts.net/ for providing ttf font files. Thanks to Android Asset Studio for providing awesome button icons and colors. And thank you to AndroidGenuine for the accelerometer tutorial. 

We tested our app on the following devices:

Motorola Droid Bionic 
HTC Droid DNA
Taps will be monitored during set period
Remind me to export daily wash data

Select Auto monitor if you want Soap to automatically monitor your taps on the phone at specific times, such as your work day. To select the time range, choose a start day and an end day and a start and end time for each day (ex. Mon - Fri, 9am - 5pm) 

	Export Reminder will pop up a notification to remind you to export your data at the end of the day 

	Add a default email so that you won't have to provide it each time you export data.
